titleStmt.title: TO THE MOST HIGH AND PVISSANT PRINCE, CHARLES by the Grace of God, the first of that Name, and second Monarch of the whole Iland of Great BRITTAINE:
titleStmt.author: Taylor, John

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: TO THE MOST HIGH AND PVISSANT PRINCE, CHARLES by the Grace of God, the first of that Name, and second Monarch of the whole Iland of Great BRITTAINE:
analytic.author: Taylor, John

monogr.title: A liuing sadnes, in duty consecrated to the immortal memory of our late deceased albe-loued soueraigne Lord, the peereles paragon of princes, Iames, king of great Brittaine, France and Ireland : Who departed this life at his mannour of Theobalds, on Sunday last, the 27. o March, 1625
monogr.author: Taylor, John

div.head: TO THE MOST HIGH AND PVISSANT PRINCE, CHARLES by the Grace of God, the first of that Name, and second Monarch of the whole Iland of Great BRITTAINE:
div.p: His vndoubted Royalties being vnited vnder one and the same his most glorious Crowne, the Kingdoms of England, Scotland, France, and Ireland;
Gods Immediate Vice-Gerent; Supreame head of all Persons, and Defender of the true, ancient Christian Faith, in these his Empires and Dominions.
div.l: MOst Mighty Monarch of this mourning Land,

l.hi: Vpon the Knees of my submissiue minde:

div.l: I begge Acceptance at your Royall hand,
That my Lamenting Muse may fauour finde.
My Gracious Master was so good, so kinde,

l.hi: So iust, so much-beloued neare and farre:
Which generally did Loue, and Duty binde
From all, and from me in particular.

div.l: But as your Maiesty vndoubted are
The Heyre vnto his Vertues and his Crowne:
I pray, that whether HEAVEN send Peace or War
You likewise may inherit his Renowne.
And as Death strucke his Earthly Glory downe,
Left you in Maiestie, and mourning Chiefe:

l.hi: Yet through the World apparently 'tis knowne

div.l: Your Sorrow is an vniuersall Griefe.
Let this recomfort then your Princely heart,
That in this Duty, all men beares a part.

closer.signed: Your Maiesties most humble and obedient Subject and Seruant: IOHN TAYLOR.
